resources.string:
The simplest definition of an adjective is that it is a word that describes or clarifies a noun. Adjectives describe nouns by giving some information about an object's size, shape, age, color, origin or material. 
 
 Some Examples are: 
 
 • Big			• Round 			• Old 			• Brown

A plural noun is simply a noun but made plural. A noun is a word that functions as the name of some specific thing or set of things, such as living creatures, objects, places, actions, qualities, states of existence, or ideas.
 
 Some Examples are: 
 
 • Trees			• Movies 			• Computers 			• Dogs

A noun (from Latin n≈çmen, literally meaning "name") is a word that functions as the name of some specific thing or set of things, such as living creatures, objects, places, actions, qualities, states of existence, or ideas.
 
 Some Examples are: 
 
 • Cat			• Table 			• Love 			• Mount Kilimanjaro
Eeeeuhrmm... What was a noun again?
Eeeeuhrmm... What was a plural noun again?
Eeeeuhrmm... What was a adjective again?
